conclusion: Determine the magnitude of the Ampere force on the V-shaped wire.
The wire forms a V-shape with each side having a length \( l \) and an included angle of \( 60^\circ \).
Consider vector components of the wire's length.
The magnetic field \( \mathbf{B} \) is perpendicular to the plane of the wire.
Find the component of the wire that contributes to the force.
Calculate the effective length \( L_{\text{eff}} \) using geometry.
Total effective length \( L_{\text{eff}} = l + l \cos(60^\circ) = \frac{3l}{2} \).
Effective length that experiences the magnetic force is \( L_{\text{eff}} = l \).
Ampere force formula: \( F = I \cdot L_{\text{eff}} \cdot B \).
Substitute values: \( F = I \cdot l \cdot B \).
Calculate total force: \( F_{\text{total}} = I l B \).
Magnitude of the Ampere force is \( \boxed{I l B} \).
